articles.title: Judge Weighs Big Changes to Google, Including Breakup, AI Limits
articles.content: (Bloomberg) -- The federal judge who will decide how to limit Google’s monopoly in search is considering its advantage in artificial intelligence, and aiming to minimize harm to the other players in the market with any resolution. articles.title: US Smartphone Manufacturing Is a 'Dream': IDC's Popal
articles.content: Smartphone manufacturing in the US is a "dream," says Nabila Popal, IDC senior research director. She discusses her research with Ed Ludlow on "Bloomberg Technology."

articles.title: Elon Musk's renewed 'laser focus' on Tesla is his 'redemption arc'
articles.content: Elon Musk is back at Tesla (TSLA) after serving as a special government employee leading US President Trump's Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE). Intelligent Alpha founder and CEO Doug Clinton joins Market Domination with Josh Lipton, Josh Schafer, and Macro Talk News founder Hope King to compare Musk's place at Tesla with the other innovative drives seen from other historic tech executives. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination here.

articles.title: The fate of Google's search empire is now up to a judge
articles.content: Google will have to wait for a US judge to decide if the company should be forced to sell off its Chrome browser.

articles.title: Apple: China Sales Collapse Is Only Getting Worse
articles.content: Apple Inc.'s challenges in China grow with declining sales and rising supply chain risk. Click for how AAPL's services remains a bright spot in a gloomy picture.

articles.title: 4 Dividend-Paying Dow Jones Growth Stocks to Buy in June and Hold for Decades
articles.content: Apple could be heavily impacted by tariffs, but the long-term investment thesis is sound.  Microsoft continues to fire on all cylinders and deserves to be near an all-time high.  Visa and American Express benefit from network effects that help them steadily grow over time.
